title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned: For each correctly drawn and labeled tension, with arrowhead in right direction

One point was deducted for each of the following until score reached zero:

No force of gravity

Each extraneous force

Any missing labels

Drawing all forces along correct lines with labels but no arrowheads received only one point.

Components of the tension in the pendulum string could be included in addition to or instead of the net tension, as long as they were clearly labeled as such.
descriptions:
The student response earns none of the following points:

1 point is earned: For each correctly drawn and labeled tension, with arrowhead in right direction

One point was deducted for each of the following until score reached zero:

No force of gravity

Each extraneous force

Any missing labels

Drawing all forces along correct lines with labels but no arrowheads received only one point.

Components of the tension in the pendulum string could be included in addition to or instead of the net tension, as long as they were clearly labeled as such.

The student response earns one of the following points:

1 point is earned: For each correctly drawn and labeled tension, with arrowhead in right direction

One point was deducted for each of the following until score reached zero:

No force of gravity

Each extraneous force

Any missing labels

Drawing all forces along correct lines with labels but no arrowheads received only one point.

Components of the tension in the pendulum string could be included in addition to or instead of the net tension, as long as they were clearly labeled as such.

The student response earns two of the following points:

1 point is earned: For each correctly drawn and labeled tension, with arrowhead in right direction

One point was deducted for each of the following until score reached zero:

No force of gravity

Each extraneous force

Any missing labels

Drawing all forces along correct lines with labels but no arrowheads received only one point.

Components of the tension in the pendulum string could be included in addition to or instead of the net tension, as long as they were clearly labeled as such.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned: For any indication that the net force is zero

1 point is earned: For an attempt to determine the components of the tension in the pendulum string

1 point is earned: For correctly determining these components

Th = Tp sin 30°

mg = Tp cos 30°

T h mg = sin30° cos30° =tan30° MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaWaaSaaaeaaca WGubWaaSbaaSqaaiaadIgaaeqaaaGcbaGaamyBaiaadEgaaaGaeyyp a0ZaaSaaaeaaciGGZbGaaiyAaiaac6gacaaIZaGaaGimaiabgclaWc qaaiGacogacaGGVbGaai4CaiaaiodacaaIWaGaeyiSaalaaiabg2da 9iGacshacaGGHbGaaiOBaiaaiodacaaIWaGaeyiSaalaaa@4EA1@

Th = tan 30°

Th = (1.8 kg)(9.8 m/s2) tan 30°

1 point is earned: For the correct answer with units

Th = 10 N

Alternate solution

2 points are earned: For indicating that the addition of the three force vectors gives a 30-60-90 right triangle

1 point is earned: For a correct trigonometric relationship between forces
Th / mg = tan 30°

1 point is earned: For the correct answer with units

Th = 10 N

If no forces were drawn in part (a), one point could be earned for writing the component equations T = mg sin θ and T = mg cos θ, and two points for T = mg tan θ.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned: For any indication of conservation of energy

1 point is earned: For any indication of the need to use a change in height

mg h 0 + 1 2 m v 0 2 =mg h f + 1 2 m v f 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamyBaiaadE gacaWGObWaaSbaaSqaaiaaicdaaeqaaOGaey4kaSYaaSaaaeaacaaI XaaabaGaaGOmaaaacaWGTbGaamODamaaDaaaleaacaaIWaaabaGaaG Omaaaakiabg2da9iaad2gacaWGNbGaamiAamaaBaaaleaacaWGMbaa beaakiabgUcaRmaalaaabaGaaGymaaqaaiaaikdaaaGaamyBaiaadA hadaqhaaWcbaGaamOzaaqaaiaaikdaaaaaaa@4AD0@

1 point is earned: For setting v0 = 0

1 2 m v f 2 =mgΔh v f = 2gΔh Δh=L−Lcos30° v f = 2gL(1−cos30°) v f = 2(9.8  m/s 2 )(2.3 m)(1−cos30°) MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGceaqabeaadaWcaa qaaiaaigdaaeaacaaIYaaaaiaad2gacaWG2bWaa0baaSqaaiaadAga aeaacaaIYaaaaOGaeyypa0JaamyBaiaadEgacqqHuoarcaWGObaaba GaamODamaaBaaaleaacaWGMbaabeaakiabg2da9maakaaabaGaaGOm aiaadEgacqqHuoarcaWGObaaleqaaaGcbaGaeuiLdqKaamiAaiabg2 da9iaadYeacqGHsislcaWGmbGaci4yaiaac+gacaGGZbGaaG4maiaa icdacqGHWcaSaeaacaWG2bWaaSbaaSqaaiaadAgaaeqaaOGaeyypa0 ZaaOaaaeaacaaIYaGaam4zaiaadYeacaGGOaGaaGymaiabgkHiTiGa cogacaGGVbGaai4CaiaaiodacaaIWaGaeyiSaaRaaiykaaWcbeaaaO qaaiaadAhadaWgaaWcbaGaamOzaaqabaGccqGH9aqpdaGcaaqaaiaa ikdacaGGOaGaaGyoaiaac6cacaaI4aGaaeiiaiaab2gacaqGVaGaae 4CamaaCaaaleqabaGaaGOmaaaakiaacMcacaGGOaGaaGOmaiaac6ca caaIZaGaaeiiaiaab2gacaqGPaGaaeikaiaaigdacqGHsislciGGJb Gaai4BaiaacohacaaIZaGaaGimaiabgclaWkaacMcaaSqabaaaaaa@7CE3@

1 point is earned: For the correct answer, with units

vf = 2.5 m/s

A solution that used the kinematic equation vf2 = v02 + 2as could only receive full credit if the student explained how the equation is equivalent to conservation of energy.
